link.label: SARL application with JavaFX user interface
link.text: This template provides the base implementation of a SARL software that is using a JavaFX user interface.

link.label: A Helloworld Agent in SARL
link.text: A simple agent displaying Hello on the console and dying 2sec later.

link.label: Agent with a behavior
link.text: A simple agent playing an externally described behavior to compute a factorial.

link.label: Agent with a behavior extending an existing behavior
link.text: A simple example to illustrate the richness of behavior inheritance and corresponding overload in SARL.

link.label: A simple Agent decrementing an integer before dying
link.text: A first illustration of the concept of task to schedule a sub process doing something from a given behavior.

link.label: A first example of holarchy
link.text: Creation of complete hierarchy of holons.

link.label: Two simple agents in basic interaction
link.text: A first agent creates two other agents, the first one counting to 3 before dying and sending message to the second.

link.label: Two examples of factorial computation
link.text: The first demo introduces a single agent computing a factorial, the second one introduces two agents in interaction: the first agent asking the second to compute the factorial value of a specified integer.

link.label: Fireworks in SARL
link.text: A JavaFX application showing fireworks on the screen.

link.label: Sierpinky's fractals
link.text: A JavaFX application showing Sierpinky's fractals on the screen.

link.label: Game of Life in SARL
link.text: A JavaFX application showing the Game of Life on the screen.

link.label: Reynolds' Boids with AWT interface
link.text: An AWT application showing the simulation of Reynolds' Boids.

link.label: Auction between holonic members
link.text: This project contains the code of the official tutorial related to holonic auctions. The auctioneer creates bidding agents into its inner context. The bidding agents send their offers to the parent agent, i.e. the auctioneer. The auctioneer selects the best offer.

link.label: Agent interaction with Ping-Pong protocol
link.text: This project contains the implementation of the simple interaction protocol named "Ping-Pong". An agent fire a ping event. The receiving agent replies with a pong event. Then, the pong event receiver replies with a new ping event, and so on.

link.label: Agent interaction inside a specific space with Ping-Pong protocol
link.text: This project contains the implementation of the simple interaction protocol named "Ping-Pong". An agent fire a ping event. The receiving agent replies with a pong event. Then, the pong event receiver replies with a new ping event, and so on. The events are exchanged inside a specific event space.
